results.title: Sunflowers
results.creator_credit: Ian McMillan and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An experimental film which admirably exploits the photogenic qualities of sunflowers. After a poetic opening a rapid montage of images links the flowers with the processes of birth, life and death,

results.title: Sunday lark
results.creator_credit: Sanford Semel and Pathe Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted satire about the computers and gadgets of big business. When a small Chinese-American girl wanders into a modern office building on a Sunday her innocent delight in pressing buttons and using the gadgets creates such chaos that the guard calls for police reinforcements. As they arrive the little girl slips out of the building unnoticed.

results.title: Sun on the stubble
results.creator_credit: Robert Marchand, Terry Jennings, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC, FA and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Bruno Gunter, a 14 year-old boy from a German immigrant family grows up on a wheat farm in South Australia during the 1930’s. Even though his father is strict and an advocate of hard work, Bruno finds plenty of mischief and adventure. He has to deal with a new school teacher, the feud between Jack Ryan and Hermann Heinz as well as coping with his family. This adaptation of Thiele’s novels will delight the family as a byegone era is vividly recreated and a period of Australia’s history and heritage is bought to life. Starring Jamie Croft as Bruno, Christian Kohlund as his father and Susan Lyons as his mother. Based on four novels written by Colin Thiele.

results.title: Summerhill (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dennis Miller, Cecily Burwash and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Visits England’s progressive co-educational boarding school, Summerhill, founded by Alexander Neill a half century ago. Aims to show that students can make decisions about their studies without lessening the quality of their education.

results.title: Summer pageantry
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Hector Lemieux and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It is a sight to gladden the heart of every spectator when the changing of the guard takes place on the broad green lawns of Ottawa’s Parliament Buildings and when the band of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police plays their sunset Retreat. Both traditional ceremonies are shown in full colour, as are other points of interest in and around the city including scenic drives and waterways, historic stone buildings and modern edifices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Balla, Hector Lemieux and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Summer is for kids
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The warmly human narrative of what two weeks at a Muskoka summer camp meant to a small boy from a congested city area. School was out. Roger had passed. Next year he’d be using ink, but in the meantime there wasn’t much to do around town. Then, one wonderful day, Roger went off to camp. It was all fun, the preliminary scramble for the upper bunk in the cabin, exploring in the woods, cooking food over a fire, and - biggest day of all - passing the beginner’s swimming test. The two weeks went by so quickly, but it was the best time Roger had ever had, and one he would never forget. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: Submarine control
results.creator_credit: Bob Privett, Allan Crick and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An explanation of the basic principles of hydrostatics which govern the movements of submarines. The film includes simple demonstrations of neutral, positive and negative buoyancies and methods used to keep a submarine in trim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Privett, Allan Crick and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
